results.description:
READ BELOW FOR "BASIC STEPS FOR ORDERING"
↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓


Please mention your desired text/design to be engraved in the “note to Pickslay’s Woodworking” or "optional note to seller" (if using the Etsy app) which will be an option after you add the item to your cart.

PLEASE DOUBLE CHECK TO SEE IF YOUR NOTE FOR YOU ORDER WENT THROUGH. IF NOT, PLEASE CONTACT ME WITH YOUR REQUEST AND I'LL ADD IT TO YOUR ORDER

Image of “note to Pickslay’s Woodworking”
This is how it should look on a computer:
https://img0.etsystatic.com/073/0/13072729/icm_fullxfull.66546616_6g59b2vjgw844w8os4g4.jpg

Image of "optional note to seller" 
This is how it should look on a smartphone on the Etsy App:
https://img1.etsystatic.com/074/0/13072729/icm_fullxfull.66518715_6h99lm9mo58go04sgsws.jpg


Please note that if you navigate away from your cart during the checkout process, any messages you have left in the note box will NOT be saved and you will have to re-enter this information.



Here you can choose from different wood types and request custom engravings. (This form of engraving is called “Pyrography”, which is the art of drawing with FIRE!)

PLEASE LOOK THROUGH ALL THE PICTURES ABOVE BEFORE PURCHASING TO SEE ALL THE OPTIONS AVAILABLE

>>>>>>>>>>>>BASIC STEPS FOR ORDERING<<<<<<<<<<<

STEP 1: Select the Option “One/Both Sides

- Choose “Engrave One Side” for just an engraving on the front of the pick. 

- Choose “Engrave Both Sides” for engravings on both the front and back of the pick

STEP 2: CHOOSE A WOOD TYPE

-Refer to the 5th picture for wood type options (mixture of exotic, domestic, and very unique wood speicies)

STEP 3: ENGRAVING REQUEST INSTRUCTIONS

-Customizing/Personalizing OR Choosing a Design:
  
Please mention your desired text/design to be engraved in the “note to Pickslay’s Woodworking” which will be an option after you add the item to your cart.

>Here’s an example:
Front of pick:
“I Pick You” (Font Option 2)

Back of pick:
Image A (Musical Heart) 

STEP 4: ADD TO CART
Remember to mention your desired text/design to be engraved in the “note to Pickslay’s Woodworking”

>>>>ALL DONE, CONTACT ME IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS<<<<





->CONTINUE READING IF YOU WANT MORE DETAILS



[New to Etsy?]
Click the link below for How to Order on Etsy:
https://www.etsy.com/help/article/339?ref=help_search_result



[CONTACT ME]

Click the link below or click the contact button to contact me:
https://www.etsy.com/conversations/new?with_id=13072729&ref=owner_contact_leftnav



[SAMPLE DESIGNS DESCRIPTIONS] 1ST PHOTO

1. I Pick You (shown in font option 2) as shown on a Maple wood guitar pick on the far left in the 1st picture above. 

Request Example:
“I Pick You” (Font Option 2)

2. (Initial)(& sign)(Initial) (Date) (shown in font option 2) Mahogany wood guitar pick 2nd from the left in the 1st picture above 

Request Example:
“T&K 2•8•14” (Font Option 2)

3. (Your Custom Text Here) (shown in font option 1) as shown on a Cherry wood guitar pick 

Request Example:
“Happy Birthday Justin!” (Font Option 1)

4. (Initial)(+)(Initial) inside of a Heart as shown on a Padouk wood guitar pick 2nd from the right 

Request Example:
"I + S" (Font Option 1) inside of a heart

5. (Initials) (shown in font option 2) as shown on a Bubinga wood guitar pick on the far right.

Request Example:
"SKP" initials (Font Option 2)



[FONT OPTIONS] 2ND PHOTO

[MAXIMUM CHARACTER LIMITS] 

****characters include spaces between words on the same row*****

- 1st Row 7 Characters 
– 2nd Row 7 Characters 
– 3rd Row 6 Characters
– 4th Row 3 Characters
23 Characters Total and Limit of 4 Rows

EXCEPTIONS:
Exceptions may be made, but only using font option 1. This is concerning legibility. Feel free to contact me about flexibility with what can fit on the guitar pick. Too many characters will make it harder to see. The more characters, the smaller the font will be.

****************************************************************
KEEP IN MIND THAT I'M DOING THIS BY HAND AND THAT A GUITAR PICK IS SMALL, SO KEEP THE DESIGNS SIMPLE/TEXT CHARACTER AMOUNT SMALL PLEASE. ALSO, I’M NOT A MACHINE, THEREFORE DESIGNS WON’T BE IDENTICAL. PRECISION IS MY GOAL, SO I WILL DO MY BEST.
.***************************************************************



[WOOD TYPE OPTIONS] Refer to 5th Picture above

QUANTITY: 
I do my best to keep a quantity of 10 of each wood type in stock at all times. If you want more than 10 of one wood type, please contact me

ORIGIN: 
If you want to know where these wood species come from, please click the link below to see these wood types individually described. 

CLICK THE ZOOM BUTTON BELOW THE PHOTO TO ZOOM IN ON THE WOOD TYPES

https://www.etsy.com/shop/PickslaysWoodworking?section_id=11548737&ref=shopsection_leftnav_1




[DESIGNS AND TEXT DESIGN OPTION DESCRIPTIONS] 
(Refer to 3rd or 4th picture above) 

All examples were engraved on Cherry Wood (My #1 recommended wood type for engravings)

IMAGES FROM THE 3RD PICTURE:

A. Musical Heart ----B. Electric Guitar ----C. Bird ----D. Tree ----E. Anchor 
----F. Chevron ----G. Treble Clef ----H. Mustache ----I. Bass Clef 
---- J. Buck ----K. Handprint ----L. Sea Turtle ----M. Wolf 
----N. F-Sound Holes Music Symbol ----O. Classic Guitar ----P. Elephant 

TEXT DESIGNS FROM THE 4TH PICTURE::

1. I (Heart) Guitar (in font option 1) 
2. Keep Calm And ROCK On (in font option 1)
3.(Your Name Here) (in font option 2) 
4. (Initials)(Anchor)(Initials) (in font option 3)
5. You Are My Rock (star) (in font option 1)
6. (Initial)(Heart)(Initial) (in font option 2)
7. Dad, You Rock! (in font option 1)
8. (Your Band Name Here) (in font option 1)
9. I Pick You (going down the left side) With three hearts (in font option 1) 
10. (Initial)(& sign)(Initial) Forever (in font option 2)
11. I’ll Always Pick You (in font option 2)
12. (Date) (in font option 2) For example 2•8•14
13. HIS (in font option 2)
14. HERS (in font option 2)
15. (Initial)(plus sign)(Initial) (Date) (going down the left side) (in font option 1) 
For example T+K 2•8•14
16. Couldn’t pick a better dad (in font option 1 ONLY)
17. Keep Calm And Strum On (in font option 1)
18. I Pick You (Heart) (in font option 2) 
19. (Coordinates) (in font option 1) (here is a degree symbol to copy and paste ˚ )
20. MR. (in font option 2) 
21. MRS. (in font option 2) 
22. Play For Me (in font option 3) 
23. You Rock (in font option 3) 
24. (Initial) (in font option 3) 



[FAQs]

Q: WHERE TO PUT INFO FOR MY CUSTOM TEXT?

A: Please mention your desired text/design to be engraved in the “note to Pickslay’s Woodworking” which will be an option after you add the item to your cart.

Q: HOW LONG DOES IT TAKE FOR SHIPPING?

A: Please click the link below for Shipping or the box above listed "Shipping & Policies" below the photos

https://www.etsy.com/shop/PickslaysWoodworking/policy?ref=shopinfo_policies_leftnav

Q: HOW DO I ADD MULTIPLE PICKS WITH DIFFERENT WOOD TYPES/OPTIONS?

A: Please "Add to Cart" one guitar pick at a time and then purchase all guitar picks together.

Q: WHERE ARE THE FONT OPTIONS?

A: (Refer to 2nd picture above)

Q: HOW BIG ARE THESE PICKS? 

A: My guitar picks are approximately 
>1 1/16 inch or 26 mm wide
>1 1/2 inch long or 31 mm
>1/8 of an inch thick or 3 mm thick to insure durability and to allow the grooves at the top of the pick to be deeper, allowing for better grip

Some guitar picks may not be exactly those dimensions. But I do my best to make them as close to those measurements as I can. I do this by hand and I have to estimate as I sand them by hand. 

Q. CAN YOU ACTUALLY PLAY WITH THESE?
A: Yes, I practice guitar and use them on my acoustic guitar. Wood guitar picks offer a much clearer and stronger strum. It gives a very earthy tone. You’ll hear and notice it when you try it. 

Feel and sound:

For sound,
They make a great smooth sound when they hit the strings. It doesn't have that plasticky sound that a plastic pick has as it rolls off each string. Customers and friends say that they have a beautiful earthy tone.

For feel,
Smooth to the touch, great grip at the top. It's hard to see in the pictures, but there are indentations at the top on both sides for gripping. Engravings add some roughness but give more friction to make it even easier to grip.

Check to see pictures of the indentations for the grip at the top of the pick at my about page:

https://www.etsy.com/shop/PickslaysWoodworking/about?ref=l2-about




[DIFFERENCE BETWEEN PLASTIC AND WOOD PICKS]


>Wood has no flexibility and is very firm.
> Wood offers a much clearer and stronger strum
> It doesn't have that plastic plucking sound that most plastic picks have as the pick catches on every string. 
> It gives a very earthy tone.


*grain patterns will vary from pick to pick, 
the above picture is a stock photo,
however, other picks will compare in quality, color, and grain pattern

Thanks for looking,
Spencer

results.title: Sapele - Wooden Guitar Pick - Wood Guitar Pick - Wood Plectrum - Exotic Wood - Wood Gift
results.description:
!!!!!!CUSTOM ENGRAVING!!!!!! THIS WOOD TYPE IS CUSTOMIZABLE FOR ONLY $3.50 PER SIDE. 

CLICK THE LINK BELOW FOR CUSTOMIZING OPTIONS. YOU CAN FIND THIS WOOD TYPE ON THIS LINK UNDER THE “WOOD TYPE OPTION ON THE RIGHT HAND SIDE:
https://www.etsy.com/listing/100384851/one-custom-engraved-wooden-guitar-pick?ref=shop_home_active_1

This wooden guitar pick is made out of Sapele. (This wood comes from Africa)

Sapele has simple, but beautiful dark colored grains and has the perfect density to be a sturdy guitar pick. 

It is sanded down to a very smooth finish to show off its great color. At the top of the pick there are finger grips to keep the pick from slipping while strumming. 

Makes for the perfect gift for any music lover or guitar player. 

Difference between plastic and wood picks: 
>Wood is much stiff and has little to no flexibility
> It offers a much clearer and stronger strum
> It doesn't have that plastic plucking sound that most plastic picks have as the pick catches on every string. 

Common Q&As:

Q: How big are these picks? 

A: My guitar picks are approximately 
>1 1/16 inch or 26 mm wide
>1 1/2 inch long or 31 mm
>1/8 of an inch thick or 3 mm thick to insure durability and to allow the grooves at the top of the pick to be deeper, allowing for better grip

Some guitar picks may not be exactly those dimensions. But I do my best to make them as close to those measurements. I do this by hand and I have to estimate as I sand them by hand. 

Q. Can you actually play with these?
A: Yes, I practice guitar and use them on my acoustic guitar. Wood guitar picks offer a much clearer and stronger strum. It gives a very earthy tone. You’ll hear and notice it when you try it.

Feel and sound:

For sound,
They make a great smooth sound when they hit the strings. It doesn't have that plasticky sound that a plastic pick has as it rolls off each string. Customers and friends say that they have a beautiful earthy tone.

For feel,
Smooth to the touch, great grip at the top. It's hard to see in the pictures, but there are indentations at the top on both sides for gripping. Engravings add some roughness but give more friction to make it even easier to grip.

Check to see pictures of the indentations for the grip at the top of the pick at my about page:

https://www.etsy.com/shop/PickslaysWoodworking/about?ref=l2-about


*grain patterns will vary from pick to pick, 
the above picture is a stock photo,
however, other picks will compare in quality, color, and grain pattern as shown in the 2nd picture

Please click the blue Contact button if you have any questions.
Thanks for looking,
Spencer

Q: WHERE TO PUT INFO FOR MY CUSTOM TEXT?

https://www.etsy.com/shop/PickslaysWoodworking/policy?ref=shopinfo_policies_leftnav

Q: HOW DO I ADD MULTIPLE PICKS WITH DIFFERENT WOOD TYPES/OPTIONS?

A: Please "Add to Cart" one guitar pick at a time and then purchase all guitar picks together.

Q: WHERE ARE THE FONT OPTIONS?

A: (Refer to 2nd picture above)

Q: HOW BIG ARE THESE PICKS? 

A: My guitar picks are approximately 
>1 1/16 inch or 26 mm wide
>1 1/2 inch long or 31 mm
>1/8 of an inch thick or 3 mm thick to insure durability and to allow the grooves at the top of the pick to be deeper, allowing for better grip

Some guitar picks may not be exactly those dimensions. But I do my best to make them as close to those measurements as I can. I do this by hand and I have to estimate as I sand them by hand. 

Q. CAN YOU ACTUALLY PLAY WITH THESE?
A: Yes, I practice guitar and use them on my acoustic guitar. Wood guitar picks offer a much clearer and stronger strum. It gives a very earthy tone. You’ll hear and notice it when you try it. 

Feel and sound:

For sound,
They make a great smooth sound when they hit the strings. It doesn't have that plasticky sound that a plastic pick has as it rolls off each string. Customers and friends say that they have a beautiful earthy tone.

For feel,
Smooth to the touch, great grip at the top. It's hard to see in the pictures, but there are indentations at the top on both sides for gripping. Engravings add some roughness but give more friction to make it even easier to grip.

Check to see pictures of the indentations for the grip at the top of the pick at my about page:

https://www.etsy.com/shop/PickslaysWoodworking/about?ref=l2-about




[DIFFERENCE BETWEEN PLASTIC AND WOOD PICKS]


>Wood has no flexibility and is very firm.
> Wood offers a much clearer and stronger strum
> It doesn't have that plastic plucking sound that most plastic picks have as the pick catches on every string. 
> It gives a very earthy tone.


*grain patterns will vary from pick to pick, 
the above picture is a stock photo,
however, other picks will compare in quality, color, and grain pattern

Thanks for looking,
Spencer

results.title: Wooden Pen - Curly Maple - Wood Carving - Slimline Twist Pen - Hand Carved Wood Pen
results.description:
This a Wooden Slimline-Style Pen that is hand carved from Curly Maple.

Wooden Slimline-Style Pen is made out of Curly Maple. (This specific wood comes from Northeastern North America)

Curly Maple has great natural hues because it has light colored grains with crisscross shades that reflect in the light. (Curly - the crisscross shades in wood that reflect light, which is a phenomenon that occurs in a tree due to unknown environmental circumstances) (Also known as Tiger Stripe Maple)

It was carved with chisels on a wood lathe for the purpose of being a unique writing instrument. 


The gorgeous grain figuration make this pen a unique piece.




Dimensions:
1/2 - 3/8" diameter 
5 1/8" long

Slimline twist pens have locking refill mechanisms that accept Cross style refills. The metal parts on this pen have a Satin Nickel Finish


>>>>>>Shipping:
Since this is a finished product, please allow 1-3 business days for the item to be shipped and Priority Mail Shipping which is 1-3 business days.


Thanks for looking,
Pickslay's Woodworking

↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓

Here you can choose from different wood types and request custom engravings. (This form of engraving is called “Pyrography”, which is the art of drawing with FIRE!)

PLEASE LOOK THROUGH ALL THE PICTURES ABOVE BEFORE PURCHASING TO SEE ALL THE OPTIONS AVAILABLE

>>>>>>>>>>>>BASIC STEPS FOR ORDERING<<<<<<<<<<<

STEP 1: Select the Option “One/Both Sides

- Choose “Engrave One Side” for just an engraving on the front of the pick. 

- Choose “Engrave Both Sides” for engravings on both the front and back of the pick

STEP 2: CHOOSE A WOOD TYPE

-Refer to the 5th picture for wood type options (mixture of exotic, domestic, and very unique wood speicies)

STEP 3: ENGRAVING REQUEST INSTRUCTIONS

-Customizing/Personalizing OR Choosing a Design:
  
Please mention your desired text/design to be engraved in the “note to Pickslay’s Woodworking” which will be an option after you add the item to your cart.

>Here’s an example:
Front of pick:
“I Pick You (Heart)” (Text Design 18) (Font Option 2)

Back of pick:
Image A (Musical Heart) 

STEP 4: ADD TO CART
Remember to mention your desired text/design to be engraved in the “note to Pickslay’s Woodworking”

>>>>ALL DONE, CONTACT ME IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS<<<<





->CONTINUE READING IF YOU WANT MORE DETAILS



[New to Etsy?]
Click the link below for How to Order on Etsy:
https://www.etsy.com/help/article/339?ref=help_search_result



[CONTACT ME]

Click the link below or click the contact button to contact me:
https://www.etsy.com/conversations/new?with_id=13072729&ref=owner_contact_leftnav



[SAMPLE DESIGNS DESCRIPTIONS] 1ST PHOTO

1. I Pick You (shown in font option 2) as shown on a Maple wood guitar pick on the far left in the 1st picture above. 

Request Example:
“I Pick You” (Font Option 2)

2. (Initial)(& sign)(Initial) (Date) (shown in font option 2) Mahogany wood guitar pick 2nd from the left in the 1st picture above 

Request Example:
“T&K 2•8•14” (Font Option 2)

3. (Your Custom Text Here) (shown in font option 1) as shown on a Cherry wood guitar pick 

Request Example:
“Happy Birthday Justin!” (Font Option 1)

4. (Initial)(+)(Initial) inside of a Heart as shown on a Padouk wood guitar pick 2nd from the right 

Request Example:
"I + S" (Font Option 1) inside of a heart

5. (Initials) (shown in font option 2) as shown on a Bubinga wood guitar pick on the far right.

Request Example:
"SKP" initials (Font Option 2)



[FONT OPTIONS] 2ND PHOTO

[MAXIMUM CHARACTER LIMITS] 

****characters include spaces between words on the same row*****

- 1st Row 7 Characters 
– 2nd Row 7 Characters 
– 3rd Row 6 Characters
– 4th Row 3 Characters
23 Characters Total and Limit of 4 Rows

EXCEPTIONS:
Exceptions may be made, but only using font option 1. This is concerning legibility. Feel free to contact me about flexibility with what can fit on the guitar pick. Too many characters will make it harder to see. The more characters, the smaller the font will be.

****************************************************************
KEEP IN MIND THAT I'M DOING THIS BY HAND AND THAT A GUITAR PICK IS SMALL, SO KEEP THE DESIGNS SIMPLE/TEXT CHARACTER AMOUNT SMALL PLEASE. ALSO, I’M NOT A MACHINE, THEREFORE DESIGNS WON’T BE IDENTICAL. PRECISION IS MY GOAL, SO I WILL DO MY BEST.
.***************************************************************



[WOOD TYPE OPTIONS] Refer to 5th Picture above

QUANTITY: 
I do my best to keep a quantity of 10 of each wood type in stock at all times. If you want more than 10 of one wood type, please contact me

ORIGIN: 
If you want to know where these wood species come from, please click the link below to see these wood types individually described. 

CLICK THE ZOOM BUTTON BELOW THE PHOTO TO ZOOM IN ON THE WOOD TYPES

https://www.etsy.com/shop/PickslaysWoodworking?section_id=11548737&ref=shopsection_leftnav_1




[DESIGNS AND TEXT DESIGN OPTION DESCRIPTIONS] 
(Refer to 3rd or 4th picture above) 

All examples were engraved on Cherry Wood (My #1 recommended wood type for engravings)

IMAGES FROM THE 3RD PICTURE:

A. Musical Heart ----B. Electric Guitar ----C. Bird ----D. Tree ----E. Anchor 
----F. Chevron ----G. Treble Clef ----H. Mustache ----I. Bass Clef 
---- J. Buck ----K. Handprint ----L. Sea Turtle ----M. Wolf 
----N. F-Sound Holes Music Symbol ----O. Classic Guitar ----P. Elephant 

TEXT DESIGNS FROM THE 4TH PICTURE::

1. I (Heart) Guitar (in font option 1) 
2. Keep Calm And ROCK On (in font option 1)
3.(Your Name Here) (in font option 2) 
4. (Initials)(Anchor)(Initials) (in font option 3)
5. You Are My Rock (star) (in font option 1)
6. (Initial)(Heart)(Initial) (in font option 2)
7. Dad, You Rock! (in font option 1)
8. (Your Band Name Here) (in font option 1)
9. I Pick You (going down the left side) With three hearts (in font option 1) 
10. (Initial)(& sign)(Initial) Forever (in font option 2)
11. I’ll Always Pick You (in font option 2)
12. (Date) (in font option 2) For example 2•8•14
13. HIS (in font option 2)
14. HERS (in font option 2)
15. (Initial)(plus sign)(Initial) (Date) (going down the left side) (in font option 1) 
For example T+K 2•8•14
16. Couldn’t pick a better dad (in font option 1 ONLY)
17. Keep Calm And Strum On (in font option 1)
18. I Pick You (Heart) (in font option 2) 
19. (Coordinates) (in font option 1) (here is a degree symbol to copy and paste ˚ )
20. MR. (in font option 2) 
21. MRS. (in font option 2) 
22. Play For Me (in font option 3) 
23. You Rock (in font option 3) 
24. (Initial) (in font option 3) 



[FAQs]

Q: WHERE TO PUT INFO FOR MY CUSTOM TEXT?

A: Please mention your desired text/design to be engraved in the “note to Pickslay’s Woodworking” which will be an option after you add the item to your cart.

Q: HOW LONG DOES IT TAKE FOR SHIPPING?

A: Please click the link below for Shipping or the box above listed "Shipping & Policies" below the photos

https://www.etsy.com/shop/PickslaysWoodworking/policy?ref=shopinfo_policies_leftnav

Q: HOW DO I ADD MULTIPLE PICKS WITH DIFFERENT WOOD TYPES/OPTIONS?

A: Please "Add to Cart" one guitar pick at a time and then purchase all guitar picks together.

Q: WHERE ARE THE FONT OPTIONS?

A: (Refer to 2nd picture above)

Q: HOW BIG ARE THESE PICKS? 

A: My guitar picks are approximately 
>1 1/16 inch or 26 mm wide
>1 1/2 inch long or 31 mm
>1/8 of an inch thick or 3 mm thick to insure durability and to allow the grooves at the top of the pick to be deeper, allowing for better grip

Some guitar picks may not be exactly those dimensions. But I do my best to make them as close to those measurements as I can. I do this by hand and I have to estimate as I sand them by hand. 

Q. CAN YOU ACTUALLY PLAY WITH THESE?
A: Yes, I practice guitar and use them on my acoustic guitar. Wood guitar picks offer a much clearer and stronger strum. It gives a very earthy tone. You’ll hear and notice it when you try it. 

Feel and sound:

For sound,
They make a great smooth sound when they hit the strings. It doesn't have that plasticky sound that a plastic pick has as it rolls off each string. Customers and friends say that they have a beautiful earthy tone.

For feel,
Smooth to the touch, great grip at the top. It's hard to see in the pictures, but there are indentations at the top on both sides for gripping. Engravings add some roughness but give more friction to make it even easier to grip.

Check to see pictures of the indentations for the grip at the top of the pick at my about page:

https://www.etsy.com/shop/PickslaysWoodworking/about?ref=l2-about




[DIFFERENCE BETWEEN PLASTIC AND WOOD PICKS]


>Wood has no flexibility and is very firm.
> Wood offers a much clearer and stronger strum
> It doesn't have that plastic plucking sound that most plastic picks have as the pick catches on every string. 
> It gives a very earthy tone.


*grain patterns will vary from pick to pick, 
the above picture is a stock photo,
however, other picks will compare in quality, color, and grain pattern

Thanks for looking,
Spencer

results.title: Add a Rustic Necklace to your Guitar Pick Order (Rustic Necklace ONLY) - Wooden Guitar Pick Necklace -  - Price to ADD Necklace ONLY
results.description:
Would you like to add a Rustic Necklace to your guitar pick order? Add this to any order for any guitar pick. 

THIS IS THE PRICE OF THE Rustic Necklace ONLY

A Rustic Necklace makes for the perfect gift for him or her. 

The metal clasp makes it easy for taking off and on the necklace, as shown in the 3rd picture. The brown hemp gives this item more of a rustic, classy look. 

HOW TO ORDER:

Add to cart with whatever guitar pick you're wanting to attach it to and then purchase all together. 

If ordering multiple guitar picks, please make sure to mention which guitar pick you want the key chain to be on in the “Note to Pickslay's Woodworking” that will appear after you Add to Cart the item. I will refer to that for your desired text. 

This is a Rustic Necklace ONLY. This must be added to an order of guitar pick(s).

******This is a stock photo and is only for an example of how the Rustic Necklace  looks when it is attached. 

Thanks for looking,
Spencer

results.title: Wooden Centerpiece Bowl - Multi-Wood Bowl - Maple and Walnut - Fruit Bowl - Rustic Bowl - Hand Carved Bowl  -Large Bowl-11 1/4 Inch Diameter
results.description:
This wooden Centerpiece Bowl is hand carved from a combination of Maple and Walnut wood. 

It is carved with chisels on a wood lathe for the purpose of holding change, jewelry, keys, fruit, nuts,  etc.

The blend of the rustic character, contrast between the two wood types, and the gorgeous grain figuration makes this bowl a great conversation piece.

This wood came from a nearby lumber company. Beautiful Maple and Walnut with lots of diverse grain character and contrasting colors. 

Dimensions:
11 1/4" diameter of top rim
8 3/4" diameter of bottom of bowl
1 3/8" bowl depth
2 1/2" tall


*****Covered with a mixture of natural mineral oil and beeswax. Food Safe. It can be used for fruit with skin like apples, bananas, pears, etc. And it's big enough to hold small fruit, nuts, and other small foods. 

******Wash by hand and re apply mineral oil when needed.

******Not Dishwasher or Microwave Safe.



>>>>>>Shipping:
Since this is a finished product, please allow 1-3 business days for the item to be shipped and 1-3 business days for Domestic Priority Mail shipping (does not apply to Alaska or Hawaii). 


Thanks for looking,
Pickslay's Woodworking

Some guitar picks may not be exactly those dimensions. But I do my best to make them as close to those measurements as I can. I do this by hand and I have to estimate as I sand them by hand. 

Q. CAN YOU ACTUALLY PLAY WITH THESE?
A: Yes, I practice guitar and use them on my acoustic guitar. Wood guitar picks offer a much clearer and stronger strum. It gives a very earthy tone. You’ll hear and notice it when you try it. 

Feel and sound:

For sound,
They make a great smooth sound when they hit the strings. It doesn't have that plasticky sound that a plastic pick has as it rolls off each string. Customers and friends say that they have a beautiful earthy tone.

For feel,
Smooth to the touch, great grip at the top. It's hard to see in the pictures, but there are indentations at the top on both sides for gripping. Engravings add some roughness but give more friction to make it even easier to grip.

Check to see pictures of the indentations for the grip at the top of the pick at my about page:

https://www.etsy.com/shop/PickslaysWoodworking/about?ref=l2-about




[DIFFERENCE BETWEEN PLASTIC AND WOOD PICKS]


>Wood has no flexibility and is very firm.
> Wood offers a much clearer and stronger strum
> It doesn't have that plastic plucking sound that most plastic picks have as the pick catches on every string. 
> It gives a very earthy tone.
